artifacts.summary: Analysis of FMP-guided multi-history BMCS construction, explaining why single-history approach is architecturally unsound and proposing modal saturation as the correct path to sorry-free completeness for Validity.lean

partial_progress.details: Research report created with comprehensive analysis of FMP bounds, modal saturation requirements, and comparison of approaches

findings.key_insight: Single-history construction trivializes modal/temporal semantics; correct approach requires multi-family BMCS with modal saturation
findings.fmp_modal_bound: Number of BMCS families bounded by 2^|closure| (finite subformula closure)
findings.fmp_temporal_bound: Time points per family bounded by 2*temporalDepth+1
findings.current_sorry_cause: modal_backward sorry in singleFamilyBMCS exists because single family cannot provide diamond witnesses
findings.omega_rule_limitation: Temporal backward directions (G/H) require omega-rule which is fundamentally unprovable in finitary systems

recommendations: Implement modal saturation in BMCS construction to eliminate modal_backward sorry
Do NOT use single-history TaskModel construction - it trivializes semantics
Accept temporal omega-rule limitation as mathematical reality (forward directions suffice for completeness)
Update documentation to clarify validity notion distinctions
